clinical_notes.text: Michael A. Rivera, 42 y.o. male, presents for routine exam. BP 120/76. BMI 25. Non-smoker. Exercises regularly. No complaints. Vaccinations up to date.
CBC, BMP, lipid panel normal. LDL 112. Fasting glucose 90. No abnormal values.
Complaint: sore throat, mild URI. Rapid strep negative. Supportive care advised. Symptoms resolved.
43 y.o. male. Stable health. BP 118/74. BMI 25. Colonoscopy referral discussed for age 45. Patient will plan for screening in 2 years.
Lipids: LDL 109, HDL 60. Fasting glucose 92. Stable.
Complaint: mild ankle sprain after hiking. No fracture. Conservative management. No follow-up needed.
44 y.o. male. Excellent health. Up to date on vaccinations. No complaints. Plan: continue exercise, healthy diet.
All values within normal limits. LDL 104. A1C 5.4%. Normal renal and liver function.
Screening colonoscopy performed at age 45. Findings: normal mucosa throughout, no polyps, no lesions. Recommendation: repeat in 10 years.
45 y.o. male. Reports colonoscopy was normal in 2022. BP 122/78. BMI 25. No issues. Up to date on preventive screenings.
Cholesterol 174 (LDL 106, HDL 61). Fasting glucose 93. Kidney and liver function normal.
Complaint: allergic rhinitis. Restarted loratadine 10 mg daily. No complications.
46 y.o. male. Stable health. Exercise 4x per week. Up to date on vaccines and colonoscopy. No chronic conditions.
Lipid panel and A1C within normal range. No abnormalities noted. Continue routine monitoring.
47 y.o. male. Excellent health. Colonoscopy completed in 2022, repeat not due until 2032. Labs and vaccines up to date. No new concerns. No follow-up needed at this time.
